scheduler

Class Scheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • scheduler.Scheduler

  • public class Scheduler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a tool that allows you to schedule certain things at the first free slot available that satisfies all the constraints from the assignement.

    • Method Detail

      • schedule

        public ScheduledTask schedule(UnscheduledTask unscheduledTask)
                       throws InvalidTimeSlotException,
                              InvalidSchedulingRequestException,
                              InvalidResourceException,
                              InvalidHospitalDateArgument
        Schedule method where only an UnscheduledTask is given.
        Parameters:
        Task - The unscheduled task that needs to be scheduled.
        Returns:
        A scheduled task that contains all the necessary information.
        Throws:
        InvalidResourceException
        InvalidSchedulingRequestException
        InvalidTimeSlotException
        InvalidHospitalDateArgument

      • schedule

        private ScheduledTask schedule(PatientFile patient,
                     long duration,
                     HospitalDate startDate,
                     HospitalDate stopDate,
                     java.util.LinkedList<java.util.LinkedList<Schedulable>> neededSchedulables,
                     java.util.LinkedList<Schedulable> usedSchedulables,
                     boolean[][] treeMatrix,
                     java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> fullOccurences,
                     int iteration)
                        throws InvalidSchedulingRequestException,
                               InvalidTimeSlotException,
                               InvalidResourceException,
                               InvalidHospitalDateArgument
        This method will schedule as many objects as needed from each of the linked lists in the given linked list.
        Parameters:
        duration - The length each resource needs to be scheduled for.
        startDate - The date from which this method should start looking
        stopDate - The date from which to stop looking from.
        neededSchedulables - A linked list of linked lists that's a collection of all possible resources that can be scheduled. E.g. If one would like to schedule a nurse that's working in the hospital, the first linked list should be a collection of all nurses. If one would like to schedule either nurse Jenny or nurse Jenna, the first linked list should just contain Jenny and Jenna. If one would like to schedule a nurse and a doctor, the first linked list will be a collection of all nurses and the second one will be one of all doctors etc...
        usedSchedulables - Used in the recursive call of this method.
        treeMatrix - A tree matrix is used to determine whether or not a resource has already been checked in the recursive call.
        fullOccurences - Expansion from occurences.
        occurences: 1 3 2 -> fulloccurences: 1 222 33
        iteration - Used for recursive purposes.
        Returns:
        A ScheduledTask that contains all the scheduled resources, the start time etc...
        Throws:
        InvalidSchedulingRequestException
        InvalidTimeSlotException
        InvalidResourceException
        InvalidHospitalDateArgument

        private boolean isBackToBack(HospitalDate startDate,
                   Schedulable schedulable)
                      throws InvalidTimeSlotException

      • makeCorrespondingArray

        private java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> makeCorrespondingArray(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> occurences)
        This method will expand occurences into fullOccurences
        See Also:
        schedule()

      • findBestOption

        private int findBestOption(long duration,
                 HospitalDate startDate,
                 HospitalDate stopDate,
                 boolean[] treeArray,
                 java.util.LinkedList<Schedulable> curSchedList)
                    throws InvalidSchedulingRequestException,
                           InvalidTimeSlotException,
                           InvalidHospitalDateArgument
        This method will find the best free slot from curSchedList.
        Parameters:
        duration - The length of the wanted free slot.
        startDate - The date from which to start looking from.
        stopDate - The date where to stop looking.
        treeArray - The array of the treematrix of the current list of schedulables.
        curSchedList - The current list of schedulables.
        Returns:
        An integer that represents the sequential number of the best free slot.
        Throws:
        InvalidSchedulingRequestException
        InvalidTimeSlotException
        InvalidHospitalDateArgument

      • getNextHospitalDate

        private HospitalDate getNextHospitalDate(java.util.Collection<Schedulable> curSchedList,
                               HospitalDate previousDate,
                               HospitalDate stopDate)
                                  throws InvalidTimeSlotException,
                                         InvalidSchedulingRequestException
        This method will return the HospitalDate of the start of the next free slot.
        Parameters:
        curSchedList - The current list of schedulables.
        previousDate - The date of the previous free slot.
        stopDate - The date on which we should stop looking.
        Returns:
        A HospitalDate that is the start of the next free time slot.
        Throws:
        InvalidTimeSlotException
        InvalidSchedulingRequestException

        Parameters:
        neededSchedulables - --> @see schedule()
        fullOccurences - --> @see schedule()
        Returns:
        --> @see schedule()

      • isValidToScheduleCollection

        private boolean isValidToScheduleCollection(java.util.LinkedList<java.util.LinkedList<Schedulable>> toCheck,
                                  java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> occurences)
        Will check if the called method doesn't want to e.g. schedule more nurses than there are available in the hospital.
        Parameters:
        toCheck - The collection to check.
        Returns:
        True if the given Collection of Collections should be able to be scheduled.
